title: Update branding assets (header + PWA icons), bump SW cache, and document production redeploy

requirements.summary: Replace UI/PWA branding PNG assets with regenerated versions based on the uploaded logo so header, favicon, Apple touch icon, and manifest icons all match.
acceptanceCriteria: The header logo renders using /assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png and visually matches the uploaded IMG_4299-3.jpeg.
The favicon and Apple touch icon reference /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_192x192.png and visually match the uploaded IMG_4299-3.jpeg.
The web manifest icons (/assets/generated/app-icon.dim_192x192.png and /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_512x512.png) visually match the uploaded IMG_4299-3.jpeg.

file_operations.description: Regenerate/replace this static PNG asset so it visually matches the uploaded logo IMG_4299-3.jpeg (keep the exact filename and dimensions).
Regenerate/replace this static PNG app icon so it visually matches the uploaded logo IMG_4299-3.jpeg (keep the exact filename and dimensions).
Regenerate/replace this static PNG app icon so it visually matches the uploaded logo IMG_4299-3.jpeg (keep the exact filename and dimensions).
Verify the header continues to reference /assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png for the logo and adjust any branding metadata (e.g., alt text) if needed without changing UI library sources.
Verify favicon and Apple touch icon links reference /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_192x192.png and remain correct after asset replacement.
Verify manifest icon entries continue to reference /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_192x192.png and /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_512x512.png and remain correct after asset replacement.

requirements.summary: Bump service worker cache version and ensure updated branding assets remain precached so installed PWAs/offline users receive the new logo/icons.
acceptanceCriteria: The service worker cache version is incremented so existing clients do not keep using the old cached logo/icon assets.
/assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png, /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_192x192.png, and /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_512x512.png are precached and served correctly after update.

file_operations.description: Increment CACHE_VERSION (e.g., v3 -> v4) to force cache refresh, and confirm the precache list includes /assets/generated/app-logo.dim_512x512.png, /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_192x192.png, and /assets/generated/app-icon.dim_512x512.png.
Verify the update flow prompts users to reload when a new service worker is installed so the refreshed cache (including updated branding assets) takes effect promptly.

requirements.summary: Prepare for a production rebuild/redeploy that yields a fresh working icp0.io URL and includes the updated branding + cache busting changes.
acceptanceCriteria: A new production URL is produced and opening it in a browser loads the app successfully (no HTTP 400 'Canister ID Not Resolved').
The production deployment includes the updated branding assets from REQ-1 and the cache-bust changes from REQ-2.

file_operations.description: Update the production rebuild/redeploy documentation to explicitly include: rebuilding the frontend, deploying to production, and validating the resulting icp0.io URL loads successfully and reflects updated branding assets + the bumped service worker cache version.
